  • Installing on Ubuntu 12.04

Installing on Ubuntu 12.04

  1. Enable upstream Postgresql repo following Apt instructions from Postgresql Wiki.
  2. Set the PLATFORM=ubuntu1204 variable for our Makefiles
  3. Do normal installation sequence as root user
  4. sudo su -
  5. cd ~devuser/webauthn
  6. make install PLATFORM=ubuntu1204
  7. cd ~devuser/ermrest
  8. make predeploy PLATFORM=ubuntu1204
  9. make install PLATFORM=ubuntu1204
  10. make deploy PLATFORM=ubuntu1204
  11. Enable SSL

HTTPS Notes

  1. The web service is called apache2 and some file locations and operating details differ from that documented for CentOS.
  2. The ermrest predeploy make target will run apt-get to install dependencies including self-signed certificates for apache.
  3. The HTTPS service needs to be enabled explicitly, unlike on CentOS
  4. a2enmod ssl
  5. s2ensite default-ssl
  6. service apache2 reload

Postgres Notes

Content of /etc/apt/sources.list.d/pgdg.list:

deb http://apt.postgresql.org/pub/repos/apt/ precise-pgdg main

We try to install postgresql-9.4 in our predeploy target, but you may want to install it sooner to make sure no other implicit postgres dependencies pull in an older, incompatible postgres from Ubuntu 12.04 itself.
